quest.name: The Science of Deduction
journal: Ellie wishes to share her latest discoveries with you.

Inspector's Log:
These tales of a thieving duelist continue to confound me! But perhaps it is to be expected─I am but recently returned to civilized, un-undead society, after all. The case of Yellow Moon's missing Pure Heart was a welcome refresher, to be sure, but my second case was a grim reminder that dubious acts are sometimes necessary to achieve a greater good. Still, I hold out hope that we may yet find Eleazar's sword in the possession of my nefarious nemesis. But how am I to catch him if I know naught of the “collector's blade” he seeks?
　　　　　　　　　　　　*　*　*
Using her skills as a reporter, Ellie has managed to identify the sword the duelist seeks: the Treaty-Blade, a weapon which was recently purchased by an Ul'dahn collector. Ellie is eager to investigate the collector, but she is also concerned that her friendly overtures may be rebuffed. A small gift might serve to pave the way─perhaps a rare flower purchased from Tutusi in Camp Drybone.

While in Camp Drybone, you and Ellie observe an Elezen inspector extracting a confession from a merchant who murdered his former partner. Ellie is impressed by the man's skills as an investigator─though her mood darkens upon hearing the name of a certain other inspector. Avoid further mention of the gentleman in question and journey to Vesper Bay, where the Ul'dahn collector, Lady Durilda, resides.

Lady Durilda is less than enthused with your flowers, and even further annoyed when Inspector Hildibrand and his assistant make a most inopportune appearance. It is then the agent of enquiry's turn to grow flustered when the gentleman from Camp Drybone arrives and is revealed to have been hired by Lady Durilda. Declaring that Consulting Inspector Briardien and her guardsmen can ensure the security of the Treaty-Blade, the collector demands that you all leave. However, there may be another way to earn the approval of Lady Durilda. Maria, her daughter, lost a priceless antique vase in the wilds of Thanalan, and its successful recovery may serve as sufficient proof of the inspector's investigative skills. Begin your search near Nophica's Wells.
Your investigation leads you to a large, flamboyantly dressed man. At his feet lies something man-made. Perhaps it warrants a closer look.
Alas, the vase is no more, having been crushed beneath the heel of the flamboyant oaf. However, Inspector Hildibrand appears to have a plan. First, you must gather the muddy potsherds.
In a refreshing change of pace, the potsherds you pulled from the water were in fact the ones you sought. Present them to Inspector Hildibrand.
The inspector declares that you have gathered more than enough pieces of the vase. Yet even with all the pieces, he could not possibly mean to reconstruct the vase...or could he?
objectives: Present the Althyk lavender to Durilda.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Perchance you are curious about the duelist's declared target? It so happens I have identified the weapon in question.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: The Treaty-Blade is part of an Ishgardian noble's collection─or was, I should say.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: No, it has not yet been stolen; it has been purchased by an Ul'dahn collector─the wife of a wealthy merchant living in Vesper Bay.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Suffice it to say, I would be remiss in my duties as a reporter were I to not investigate her. And should the duelist strike whilst I am present... Well, I hope I needn't explain what a golden opportunity that would be!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Ingratiating myself to her may prove to be the greatest challenge, though. I'm told she is a difficult woman to please...

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Fortunately, I am also told that she has a fondness for rare flowers─the sort Tutusi in Camp Drybone sells. You can come along, if you'd like.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: I had a feeling you couldn't resist the pull of a good story. Since you're here, why don't you choose the Althyk lavender to buy?

dialogue.name: TUTUSI
dialogue.text: Here you are, miss. Thank you for your patronage.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: (-???-)Was it for love or money that you killed him?

dialogue.name: WOMAN01315
dialogue.text: It...it was you!?

dialogue.name: MAN01315
dialogue.text: Have you gone mad? That was an Amalj'aa arrow in his back! I don't even know how to shoot a bow!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: (-Curt Gentleman-)Amalj'aa don't shoot fleeing unarmed merchants; they capture and temper them. Not that you or your victim make for convincing merchants.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: (-Curt Gentleman-)If you're going to misrepresent yourself, put some effort into it. Wear gloves, for gods' sakes, or at least don't wave your hands in front of my face!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: (-Curt Gentleman-)The calluses on your fingers betray you as a veteran archer. Doubtless you used your skills to great effect five years ago, as did your partner.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: (-Curt Gentleman-)So again, I ask: was it because he took from you your share, or your sister?

dialogue.name: MAN01315
dialogue.text: You don't touch a man's kin. He knew that, and yet he...he...

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: (-Curt Gentleman-)Damn. I thought he did it for the money. You two─he's all yours.

dialogue.name: DOJIN01315
dialogue.text: Y-Yes, of course! Thank you for the help, Inspector!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: ...At least he's competent. But when did investigating crimes become such a popular profession?

dialogue.name: TUTUSI
dialogue.text: It's not his job, you know; he just likes doing it. He belongs to one of Ishgard's High Houses─some say he's a baron!

dialogue.name: TUTUSI
dialogue.text: Not at all like that buffoon Hildibrand, don't you think?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: I try not to think about Hildibrand.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: We should get going. Lady Durilda will not take kindly to wilted flowers.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: I believe you have something to present to Lady Durilda? Go on, then.

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: Again!? As I told the last twenty who came before, if you have come looking for work, you are too late!

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: And even if I were in need of additional security, I would not deign to hire a common adventurer!

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: Now remove yourself from my sight before I have you removed.

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: Did you really think I could be so easily manipulated? Present the right gift, speak the magic words, and you would earn my respect?

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: What is more, a flower's beauty is fleeting. I value beauty which transcends the boundaries of time─everlasting, enduring, unchanging. Like mine. Now get out.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Forgive us, Lady Durilda. We meant no disrespect! We were afraid that you would not heed our warnings otherwise.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: A notorious, violent thief is plotting to steal the Treaty-Blade!

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: You fools. “I shall come to claim the collector's blade,” yes? I read the Mythril Eye. I know full well of whom you speak, and it is none of your concern.

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: I have a legion of guards at my disposal. Should he try, I will have him seized or worse.

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: And even if by some miracle he should succeed, he will not escape my wrath, for I have retained the services of a certain gentleman.

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: Ah, but you may see for yourself! Like every piece in my collection, he has been chosen with the utmost care. Now look on my peerless inspector, interlopers, and despair!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ships that pass in the night; a signal shown in the darkness─

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: The lady cries out for a guardian, and a gentleman must needs oblige!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I swear to you, here and now: I, Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, shall neither slumber nor sleep until the fiend who covets the Treaty-Blade is brought to justice!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: My ladyGood sir, what brings you here? Are you come in pursuit of the duelist as well? Or, perchance, in pursuit of me?

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: As if I would spend a single gil on an insufferable, incompetent─

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: (-???-)To be fair, you are not spending a single gil on me.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: (-Curt Gentleman-)The chance to investigate such an intriguing case is payment enough. Preemptive declarations of criminal intent are hardly in vogue.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: (-Curt Gentleman-)Sorry I'm late. Busy solving a murder.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Briardien, consulting inspector. At your service, my lady.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Conniving inspector?

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Consulting inspector.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: <sniff> <sniff> Rotting flesh and saltpeter. Hildibrand Manderville and Nashu Mhakaracca, I presume.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Two rank amateurs playing at a profession of which they know naught.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Call me when you've finished with these wastrels.

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: You see!? I do not want nor need your help. Briardien is more than capable of overseeing the transfer. Now get out, all of you!

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: Where have you been, Maria? And where is my vase?

dialogue.name: MARIA
dialogue.text: There was this strange flying thing, and I... The vase, I dropped it in the water. I was so─

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: That vase once belonged to the Royal House of Thorne! Do you have any idea how much it was worth!?

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: You will go back outside right now and search for my vase, and you are not to return until you find it. Do I make myself clear?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: My lady, pray allow me to go in the girl's stead! It is not safe, for she herself spoke of a ferocious wild beast!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: With my unmatched investigative skills, I shall swiftly locate and recover the missing vase, thereby earning your respect! At which point, you will gladly grant me permission to investigate the thieving duelist! Verily, it is a plan fiendishly clever in its intricacies!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Not when spoken aloud.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Miss Maria, would you be so kind as to tell me exactly what happened?

dialogue.name: MARIA
dialogue.text: I picked up the vase in Ul'dah like Mother said, and I was on my way home...

dialogue.name: MARIA
dialogue.text: I was crossing the bridge, and then the flying thing came. I got scared, so I ran.

dialogue.name: MARIA
dialogue.text: When I stopped, it was gone. But...so was the vase. I think I dropped it in Nophica's Wells.

dialogue.name: MARIA
dialogue.text: I want to go and look! But there were scary-looking things down there. I'm scared to go alone.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: You are no longer alone, Miss Maria. We shall go together and look for the vase─all five of us!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: All four of you. I'm going after Inspector Briardien. If the duelist strikes, I mean to be there.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: B-But, Miss Ellie! How can you ignore the plight of a young girl for the sake of a story?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Because that's my job, you imbecile!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Well, we shall not be derelict in our duty to justice. Come, Nashu! We must away!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: You don't even know what the bloody vase looks like!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Maria, dear, listen─if it gets dangerous, or if you feel afraid, you run to this adventurer for help, understand?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Eager to get started, eh? Capital! You have my leave to canvass the scene for clues. Mayhap you may even find a witness or two!

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: Out, out! I have forthcoming appointments with very prestigious guests, and will suffer your presence no longer!

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01315
dialogue.text: That girl what run by earlier? Aye, I seen her. Had somethin' in her hands, but dropped it while crossin' the bridge. Didn't get a good look, but I reckon it don't matter anyroad─whatever it was, it's long gone by now.

dialogue.name: MERCHANT01315
dialogue.text: You say it was a vase, eh? I hope it wasn't valuable, 'cause it's been swept far downstream by now.

dialogue.name: CENMIN
dialogue.text: A vase? Well, anything that falls in the water is like to be swept downstream fairly quickly.

dialogue.name: CENMIN
dialogue.text: Does this have anything to do with that queer winged beast I saw earlier? No? Never mind, then.

dialogue.name: CENMIN
dialogue.text: If you're looking for something that fell from the bridge, you should consider searching downstream.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: A pox upon that thieving demon bird! He shall rue the day he crossed paths with me!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Huh? A vase? I know naught of what you─ Gah, curse this infernal refuse underfoot! Every point is a dagger!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: There is something in the water at the man's feet...

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Do the people of this land simply toss their refuse in the river? Every step is agony!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Do I spy the treasured vase of Lady Durilda over─ Oh. Oh dear.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: (-Flamboyant Oaf-)Um. Does this belong to you, child?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: (-Flamboyant Oaf-)Forgive me, I was so engrossed in my search that I did not notice...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Your search for what, pray tell?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: (-Flamboyant Oaf-)The demon bird that absconded with my weapon! I set it down for but a moment, only to see it next in the talons of that accursed creature!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: (-Flamboyant Oaf-)I gave chase, following it to these waters, and in my haste I must have stepped upon your vase.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Don't fret, Maria! I know it looks bad, but I'm sure Inspector Hildibrand will think of something!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Oh, but I already have, my faithful assistant. Hearken to me now, for as the rising sun doth dispel the dark, so shall my solution resolve our dilemma!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: But first, we must gather as many fragments of the vase as we can find!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Why does this feel so familiar...?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: How could I have been so careless...?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Come to present your findings, have you? Splendid! Let's have a look.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Well done, my friend. This should be more than sufficient for our needs.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: He has performed miracles with far less, after all...
